text: The Masa languages are a branch of Chadic languages. There are fewer than 20 that are still spoken. They are spoken in Chad and Cameroon. ==Branches== The Masa languages listed in Blench (2006) are:Blench, 2006. The Afro-Asiatic Languages: Classification and Reference List (ms) *North **Massa (Masana) **?
